metadata.Title: CVE-2023-37420 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: Multiple out-of-bounds write vulnerabilities exist in the VCDparse_valuechange portdump functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. A speciallycrafted .vcd file can lead to arbitrary code execution. A victim would needto open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.Thisvulnerability concerns the out-of-bounds write when triggered via thevcd2lxt conversion utility.

criterions.comment: gtkwave: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
